"Jealousy is a natural emotion, but instead of letting it consume you, try to channel it into something productive. Perhaps you could use that energy to tackle a task that you've been putting off or focus on improving a skill that you feel you lack."

"Why not take a step back and appreciate the accomplishments of others? Remember that everyone has their own unique talents and abilities, and there's no need to compare yourself to others. Instead, use their success as motivation to pursue your own passions and goals."

"Instead of feeling jealous, try to see the big picture and recognize that everyone has their own journey to take. You can't control how others finish their tasks, but you can control how you approach your own. Focus on your own progress and celebrate your own accomplishments, no matter how small they may seem."

"One way to combat jealousy is to shift your focus from what others are doing to what you can do. Take a moment to reflect on your own strengths and weaknesses, and set achievable goals for yourself. By focusing on your own progress, you'll be less likely to feel jealous of others."

"Another way to combat jealousy is to practice gratitude. Instead of focusing on what you don't have, try to appreciate the things that you do have. This can help shift your perspective and reduce feelings of jealousy, while also promoting a more positive outlook on life."
